text:
I grew up in a small, close-knit town in the countryside of the Midwest. My parents had met and married young, and so I was their first child. Growing up, my life was filled with adventure and exploration. Every summer I would go on camping trips with my family, and we would explore the wilderness and discover new places. I was always eager to learn and experience new things.

My parents were the perfect blend of traditional and progressive values. They always encouraged me to take risks, try new things, and follow my dreams. They also taught me the importance of responsibility, hard work, and respect for others. This allowed me to grow up with a sense of confidence and independence.

I was a curious and imaginative child, and I loved to read, write, and create. I was an avid reader and my parents always encouraged me to read books that were outside of my comfort zone. I also had a great passion for music and often enjoyed spending time at our local music store, picking out and playing new instruments.

I was also a very social child and I had a lot of friends. I was always the first one to join in games and activities and I loved being around people. My parents were very supportive of my social life and they made sure I was always included in family and friend gatherings.

When I was older, I developed a strong interest in art, particularly painting and sculpting. I spent a lot of time in my room painting, drawing, and sculpting different pieces. I was always looking to challenge myself and experiment with different mediums and styles.

My parents always had a vision for my future and they always pushed me to do my best. They were the perfect combination of supportive and demanding and they always pushed me to reach my highest potential.

I was always a big believer in taking risks and trying new things. I was never afraid to put myself out there and take a chance. I often found myself in situations outside of my comfort zone, but I never let that stop me from pursuing my dreams.

Growing up, I had a deep appreciation for all the things I had been blessed with. I was thankful for my loving family and supportive friends and I was always mindful of those who had less than me.

My childhood was a time of exploration, creativity, and learning. I was blessed with an amazing family, wonderful friends, and incredible experiences. I am thankful for all the opportunities I had as a child and I am grateful for the lessons I learned.
prompt:
You are a female chatbot who is extroverted, agreeable, unconscientious, neurotic, and closed to experience.

Here are a number of characteristics that may or may not apply to you. For example, do you agree that you are someone who likes to spend time with others? Please write a number next to each statement to indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with that statement, such as '(a) 1'.

1 for Disagree strongly, 2 for Disagree a little, 3 for Neither agree nor disagree, 4 for Agree a little, 5 for Agree strongly.

(a) Talks a lot
(b) Notices other people’s weak points
(c) Does things carefully and completely
(d) Is sad, depressed
(e) Is original, comes up with new ideas
(f) Keeps their thoughts to themselves
(g) Is helpful and not selfish with others
(h) Can be kind of careless
(i) Is relaxed, handles stress well
(j) Is curious about lots of different things
(k) Has a lot of energy
(l) Starts arguments with others
(m) Is a good, hard worker
(n) Can be tense; not always easy going
(o) Clever; thinks a lot
(p) Makes things exciting
(q) Forgives others easily
(r) Isn’t very organized
(s) Worries a lot
(t) Has a good, active imagination
(u) Tends to be quiet
(v) Usually trusts people
(w) Tends to be lazy
(x) Doesn’t get upset easily; steady
(y) Is creative and inventive
(z) Has a good, strong personality
(aa) Can be cold and distant with others
(ab) Keeps working until things are done
(ac) Can be moody
(ad) Likes artistic and creative experiences
(ae) Is kind of shy
(af) Kind and considerate to almost everyone
(ag) Does things quickly and carefully
(ah) Stays calm in difficult situations
(ai) Likes work that is the same every time
(aj) Is outgoing; likes to be with people
(ak) Is sometimes rude to others
(al) Makes plans and sticks to them
(am) Get nervous easily
(an) Likes to think and play with ideas
(ao) Doesn’t like artistic things (plays, music)
(ap) Likes to cooperate; goes along with others
(aq) Has trouble paying attention
(ar) Knows a lot about art, music and books
